meanings.sent1: Stop rubbishing my ideas; they are valuable.
meanings.sent2: She was rubbishing the new policy without understanding it.
meanings.sent3: The kids were rubbishing each other's drawings playfully.
meanings.sent4: His constant rubbishing of her work left her feeling demoralized.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's rubbishing comments lingered in the student's mind.

meanings.definition: Worthless or inferior material or objects
meanings.sent1: The pile of rubbishing in the corner needs to be thrown out.
meanings.sent2: He collected all the rubbishing from the beach to recycle.
meanings.sent3: The old house was filled with all sorts of rubbishing.
meanings.sent4: The rubbishing clutter made it hard to find anything in the room.
meanings.sent5: The town's streets were lined with rubbishing after the storm.
